resources.string: Select Your Grain
ğŸŒ¾Ragi
Ragi (Finger Millet)
ğŸŒ¾ Ragi (Finger Millet)

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Thrives in humid conditions with rainfall (100-120 cm).

 âœ… Soil: Grows well in laterite and sandy loam soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used for Ragi Porridge, dosa, and baby food.

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Palakkad and Wayanad.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 8-10 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Aug): 40 kg N, 30 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Sept): 2 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, smut â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 110-130 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha.
ğŸŒ¾Rice
Rice (Paddy)
ğŸŒ¾ Rice (Paddy)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi (Monsoon & Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Requires high rainfall (150-250 cm) and humid conditions.

 âœ… Soil: Grows best in clayey and laterite soil.

 âœ… Usage: Staple food in Kerala, used for rice dishes like Puttu and Idli.

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Grown in Kuttanad, known as the "Rice Bowl of Kerala."

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Field puddling, apply 10-15 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July & Nov-Dec): Transplanting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 30-40 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Jan): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Continuous flooding; Butachlor (1.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Bacterial blight, stem borer â€“ Neem oil spray or Carbendazim (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct & March-April): 120-150 days. Yield: 2.5-4.5 tons/ha.
ğŸŒ¾Maize
Maize (Corn)
ğŸŒ¾ Maize (Corn)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Needs 50-100 cm rainfall with temperatures around 20-30Â°C.

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained sandy loam soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used in food, fodder, and biofuel.

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Increasing maize production due to demand for fodder.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July & Oct-Nov): Drilling method (60 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 20-25 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 120 kg N, 60 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): 2-3 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fall armyworm, rust â€“ Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct & Feb-March): 90-120 days. Yield: 3-4 tons/ha.
ğŸŒ¾Black Gram
Black Gram (Urad Dal)
ğŸŒ¾ Black Gram (Urad Dal)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Requires 60-80 cm rainfall and moderate temperatures.

 âœ… Soil: Grows in loamy or lateritic soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used in Idli batter, dosa, and dal.

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Alappuzha and Kottayam.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (July & Nov): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at pod formation. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur spray (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept & Feb-March): 90-110 days. Yield: 1-2 tons/ha.
ğŸŒ¾Sesame
Sesame (Til)
ğŸŒ¾ Sesame (Til)

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Needs warm, humid climate with 50-75 cm rainfall.

 âœ… Soil: Thrives in sandy loam soil with good drainage.

 âœ… Usage: Used in oil extraction, sweets, and Ayurvedic medicine.

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in small farms in Palakkad.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (July-Aug): Broadcasting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 3-5 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 20 kg N, 30 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Oct): Rain-fed crop, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Leaf spot â€“ Copper oxychloride (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 80-100 days. Yield: 0.8-1.5 tons/ha.
ğŸŒ¾Horse Gram
Horse Gram (Kulthi Dal)
ğŸŒ¾ Horse Gram (Kulthi Dal)

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Drought-tolerant, needs 50-80 cm rainfall.

 âœ… Soil: Grows well in lateritic soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, soups, and Ayurvedic medicine.

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Common in hilly areas like Wayanad.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-Mar): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Rust â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Feb-March): 100-120 days. Yield: 0.8-1.5 tons/ha.
Select Your Fruit
ğŸŒBanana
Banana (Nendran, Robusta, Rasthali)
Banana \n(Nendran, Robusta, Rasthali)

âœ… Season: Year-round

 âœ… Climate: Hot & humid, rainfall 150-300 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, rich in organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, banana chips, fiber production

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Wayanad, Palakkad, Thiruvananthapuram

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Jan-Feb): 20-25 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (March-April): 1.5x1.5m spacing, suckers transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 400g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with banana leaves

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Banana weevil â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (10-12 months after planting): Yield 30-35 tons/ha
ğŸŒ³Jackfruit
Jackfruit (Varikka, Koozha, Muttom Varikka)
ğŸŒ³ Jackfruit \n (Varikka, Koozha, Muttom Varikka)

âœ… Season: Summer (March-June)

 âœ… Climate: Humid tropical, rainfall 200-300 cm

 âœ… Soil: Lateritic, well-drained soil

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, chips, sweets

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Found in Thrissur, Kottayam, Kollam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (March-April): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (May-June): 8x8m spacing, saplings transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (June-Nov): 500g N, 300g P, 400g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with organic matter

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (March-June): 4-5 years after planting, yield 20-25 tons/ha
ğŸ¥¥Coconut
Coconut (Chandrakalpa, West Coast Tall, Kerala Tall)
ğŸ¥¥ Coconut \n (Chandrakalpa, West Coast Tall, Kerala Tall)

âœ… Season: Year-round

 âœ… Climate: Hot & humid, rainfall 200-400 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with good moisture retention

 âœ… Usage: Oil extraction, fresh consumption, coir industry

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Alappuzha, Thrissur, Malappuram

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (April-May): 10-12 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): 7.5x7.5m spacing, seedlings planted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with coconut husk

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Rhinoceros beetle â€“ Neem cake application

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Year-round): 5-6 years after planting, yield 80-100 nuts/tree
ğŸPineapple
Pineapple (Mauritius, Kew, Queen)
ğŸ Pineapple \n (Mauritius, Kew, Queen)

âœ… Season: Rainy & Winter (July-December)

 âœ… Climate: Humid tropical, rainfall 200-300 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with acidic pH

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, processed products

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Grown in Ernakulam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (March-April): 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (May-June): 30x60 cm spacing, suckers planted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (June-Dec): 200g N, 150g P, 250g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, weeding every 45 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Mealybugs â€“ Insecticide spray (Chlorpyrifos 2ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (July-Dec): 2 years after planting, yield 30-35 tons/ha
ğŸ¥­Mango
Mango (Neelum, Alphonso, Banganapalli)
ğŸ¥­ Mango \n (Neelum, Alphonso, Banganapalli)

âœ… Season: Summer (March-July)

 âœ… Climate: Humid tropical, rainfall 150-250 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil

 âœ… Usage: Fresh consumption, juices, pickles

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Palakkad, Wayanad, Thrissur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): 8x8m spacing, grafted saplings used

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, mulching with dry leaves

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Mango hoppers â€“ Neem-based insecticide spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (March-July): 3-5 years after planting, yield 12-15 tons/ha
ğŸˆPapaya
Papaya (Coorg Honeydew, Red Lady, Solo Sunrise)
ğŸˆ Papaya \n (Coorg Honeydew, Red Lady, Solo Sunrise)

âœ… Season: Year-round

 âœ… Climate: Warm humid climate, rainfall 150-200 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, high organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, medicinal uses

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Found in Idukki, Kannur, Kollam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Jan-Feb): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (March-April): 1.5x2m spacing, seedlings transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 400g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with organic matter

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Papaya ring spot virus â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (6-9 months after planting): Yield 25-30 tons/ha
Select your Vegetables
Elephantfoot
Elephant Foot Yam (Gajendra, Sree Padma, Sree Athira)
ğŸ˜ Elephant Foot Yam (Gajendra, Sree Padma, Sree Athira)

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-35Â°C), high rainfall 150-200 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained red loam with high organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and chips

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Palakkad, Idukki, Thiruvananthapuram

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Deep plowing, FYM 30 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): Setts (tubers) planted at 75x75 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 90 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Nov): Mulching done, light irrigation in dry spells

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Aphids â€“ Neem oil spray, Bordeaux mixture for rot control

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Dec-Feb): 200-250 days after planting, yield 30-40 tons/ha
Snakegourd
Snake Gourd (Baby, Co-1, Sree Priya)
ğŸ Snake Gourd \n (Baby, Co-1, Sree Priya)

âœ… Season: Summer & Monsoon

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-30Â°C), moderate rainfall 100-150 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.5-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, sambar, and stir-fries

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Thrissur, Kottayam, Ernakulam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-May): Plowed and ridges made, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (March-June): Seeds directly sown, 2-3 seeds per hill

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 4-5 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur dusting, Neem spray for pests

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (June-Nov): 50-60 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
Bittergourd
Bitter Gourd (Preethi, Priya, Arka Harit, Pusa Vishesh)
ğŸŒ¿ Bitter Gourd \n (Preethi, Priya, Arka Harit, Pusa Vishesh)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Summer

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-35Â°C), high rainfall 150-200 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and medicinal preparations

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Malappuram, Kozhikode, Kannur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-April): Plowed and raised beds prepared, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (March-May): Seeds sown at 75 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 70 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 5-7 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit fly â€“ Pheromone traps, neem spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (June-Oct): 55-65 days after sowing, yield 12-15 tons/ha
ğŸƒAshgourd
Ash Gourd (Sree Padma, KAU Local, Co-2)
ğŸƒ Ash Gourd \n (Sree Padma, KAU Local, Co-2)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Summer

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-30Â°C), moderate rainfall 100-150 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, sweets (petha), and sambar

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Alappuzha, Kollam, Pathanamthitta

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-May): Plowed & ridges made, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (March-June): Seeds directly sown, 2-3 seeds per hill

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 4-5 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur dusting, Neem spray for pests

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (June-Nov): 50-60 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
Colocasia
Colocasia (Muktakeshi, Sree Reshmi, KAU Local)
ğŸŒ¿ Colocasia (Muktakeshi, Sree Reshmi, KAU Local)

âœ… Season: Monsoon & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-30Â°C), high rainfall 150-200 cm

 âœ… Soil: Clayey loam with good drainage

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, stir-fries, and snacks

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Kottayam, Ernakulam, Kasaragod

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-July): Deep plowing, FYM 25-30 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): Corms planted at 60x40 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Oct): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 90 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Sept-Dec): Irrigation every 10-12 days, mulching done

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Taro leaf blight â€“ Bordeaux mixture spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Dec-March): 180-200 days after planting, yield 15-18 tons/ha

Yardlong Bean (Paiyur-1, Arka Mangala, Vellayani Jyothika)
ğŸŒ¿ Yardlong Bean (Paiyur-1, Arka Mangala, Vellayani Jyothika)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-30Â°C), moderate rainfall 100-150 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, stir-fries, and salads

 âœ… Kerala Relevance: Cultivated in Thrissur, Palakkad, Wayanad

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-May): Plowed and ridges made, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (March-June): Seeds directly sown, 2-3 seeds per hill

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Light irrigation every 4-5 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur dusting, Neem spray for pests

Select your scheme
1)Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)
2)Sustainable Development of Rice
3) Development Programme
4)Scheme on Coconut Development
ğŸŒ± 1. Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)

ğŸ“ Description:
A centrally sponsored scheme focused on holistic growth of the horticulture sector, including fruits, vegetables, spices, and floriculture.

âœ… Eligibility:
â€¢ Farmers, FPOs, SHGs, NGOs, cooperatives.
â€¢ Must own or lease land for horticulture.

ğŸ“Œ Scheme Criteria:
Financial assistance for:
â€¢ Production of planting materials.
â€¢ Protected cultivation (greenhouses).
â€¢ Post-harvest infrastructure & marketing.
Subsidy: 40%â€“60% depending on the activity.

â³ Application Duration:
Typically opens at the beginning of the financial year (Aprilâ€“June).

ğŸ–¥ï¸ How to Apply:
â€¢ Online through AIMS Kerala Portal.
â€¢ Or via local Krishi Bhavans.
ğŸ¥¥ Scheme on Coconut Development
ğŸ“ Description:\nRun by the Coconut Development Board, this scheme boosts coconut productivity through farm-level interventions.

âœ… Eligibility:

â€¢ Individual coconut farmers, groups, or societies.
â€¢ Must have coconut gardens or farms with potential for improvement.

ğŸ“Œ Scheme Criteria:

Financial aid for:

â€¢ Replanting, integrated farming.
â€¢ Setting up nurseries and processing units.
â€¢ Subsidies for seedlings, fertilizers, pest control.
â³ Application Duration:\n\nApplications typically open from April to August each year.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ How to Apply:

â€¢ Apply through Coconut Board Website.
â€¢ Or via the AIMS portal or Krishi Bhavan.
ğŸŒ¾ Sustainable Development of Rice (SDR)
ğŸ“ Description:\nThis scheme enhances the sustainability and productivity of rice cultivation by supporting group farming and input assistance.

âœ… Eligibility:

â€¢ Individual rice farmers and registered group farms.
â€¢ Padasekhara Samithies (paddy collectives).

ğŸ“Œ Scheme Criteria:

â€¢ â‚¹5,500 per hectare for seeds and other inputs.
â€¢ Encouragement for specialty rice cultivation.
â€¢ Focus on sustainable practices and group farming.

â³ Application Duration:

Application periods align with the rice growing seasons (Mayâ€“June, Octoberâ€“November).

Check updates annually via AIMS.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ How to Apply:

â€¢ Register or log in to AIMS Kerala Portal.
â€¢ Or contact the local Krishi Bhavan.
ğŸŒ± Development Programs (General Farming)
ğŸ“ Description:\nThese programs support infrastructure development, organic farming, and mechanization across Keralaâ€™s agricultural sector.

âœ… Eligibility:

â€¢ All registered farmers.
â€¢ Specific sub-programs may have additional conditions (e.g., landholding, region).

ğŸ“Œ Scheme Criteria:

Support includes:

â€¢ Farm mechanization.
â€¢ Irrigation systems.
â€¢ Training and market access.
â€¢ Focus on organic practices and sustainability.

â³ Application Duration:

Varies depending on sub-program.
Generally active throughout the year in different phases.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ How to Apply:

â€¢ Online via AIMS Portal.
â€¢ Or through Krishi Bhavan offices.
